summary: The Medicare Hearing Aid Coverage Act of 2025 (H.R. 500) proposes to amend the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for hearing aids and related examinations, which are currently excluded. This change would take effect on January 1, 2026. The bill also directs the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to conduct a study on existing programs that provide hearing aid assistance and report its findings and recommendations to Congress. The primary goal is to improve healthcare access for Medicare beneficiaries with hearing loss.
